etymology.description: 乂(乂) (yì, "to govern") + 乂(乂) = two stacked 'X' marks representing divination lines
etymology.interpretation: The character 爻(yáo, "divination lines") depicts two crossing lines, resembling 'X' marks, symbolizing the divination lines used in traditional methods. These marks can be interpreted as representing either pairs of yarrow stalks used for divination or bamboo slips used for calculations. Though it might visually resemble 交(交) (jiāo, "cross") or 駁(駁) (bó, "contradict"), its primary function is depicting the meaningful crossing patterns in divination.

examples.chinese: 易经卜卦时(易經卜卦時)，观察爻的变化(觀察爻的變化)。
examples.pinyin: Yì jīng bǔ guà shí, guānchá yáo de biànhuà.
examples.english: When consulting the I Ching, one observes the changes of the divination lines.

examples.chinese: 卦中的每一个爻都蕴含宇宙奥秘(卦中的每一個爻都蘊含宇宙奧秘)。
examples.pinyin: Guà zhōng de měi yīgè yáo dōu yùnhán yǔzhòu àomì.
examples.english: Every divination line in the hexagram contains the mysteries of the universe.

examples.chinese: 大师解读时(大師解讀時)，详细说明爻的象征意义(詳細說明爻的象徵意義)。
examples.pinyin: Dàshī jiědú shí, xiángxì shuōmíng yáo de xiàngzhēng yìyì.
examples.english: When the master interprets, he elaborates on the symbolic meaning of the divination lines.
